Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to statistical concepts in modern society. Basic principles, frequency distributions, measures of location and dispersion, probability, statistical inference. The "NC" grading policy applies to this course.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: MGF 1106 or any other MAC course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: First methods course introducing probability and statistical inference, including estimation, hypothesis testing, binomial and normal distributions, sample size.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Permission of Honors; Calculus desired by not necessary.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as STA 2023 with honors-level content.

STA3032 - Probability and Statistics for.name: STA3032 - Probability and Statistics for Engineers

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: MAC 2312 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Axioms of probability; combinatorial and geometrical probability; probability distributions; measures of location and dispersion; sampling and sampling distributions; estimation and tests of hypotheses; engineering applications.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Systems

STA3032H - Honors Probability and Statis.name: STA3032H - Honors Probability and Statistics for Engineers

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: MAC 2312 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better and honors standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamental probability and statistics principles, the underlying assumptions, the procedures for implementing and interpreting them. With honors content.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Systems

STA4102 - Computer Processing of Statist.name: STA4102 - Computer Processing of Statistical Data

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: STA 4163 and knowledge of a programming language.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Use of packages such as SAS, BMD, SPSS for data validation, description and analysis of data, regression and analysis of variance and covariance.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Economics of insurance, utility theory, single premiums for insurance and annuities in both discrete and continuous cases. Net annual premium and net premium reserves.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Multiple-decrement and multi-life models. Insurance models including expenses. Modified reserves. Cash values, insurance options and asset shares. Non forfeiture benefits and dividends.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Distributional quantities, characteristics of actuarial models, continuous models, discrete distributions, frequency and severity with coverage modifications, aggregate Joss models, estimation for modified data, frequentist estimation.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Frequentist estimation for discrete distributions, Bayesian estimation, model selection, simulation, credibility for aggregate losses, pure premiums and loss ratios, EPV, VHM, Buhlmann and Buhlmann-Straub credibility.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Not open to students with credit in STA 4165. Methods of analyzing data, statistical models, estimation, tests of hypotheses, regression and correlation, an introduction to analysis of variance, chi-square, and nonparametric methods.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Methods of analyzing data, statistical models, estimation, tests of hypotheses, regression and correlation, introduction to analysis of variance, and nonparametric methods. With honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A continuation of STA 4163, including further study of regression, analysis of variance and covariance and multiple comparisons.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applied statistical principles and methods applied to problems in medical, biological, and health sciences.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Measurement of simple and compound interests, accumulated and present values factors. Annuities certain, yield rates, amortization schedules and sinking funds. Bonds, securities and related funds.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cash flow and profit for simple options and forwards, hedging strategies, Black-Scholes option pricing, simple swaps, portfolio management with derivatives, duration analysis, callable bonds.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Assumptions of derivative pricing, put-call parity, binomial pricing, market making, delta hedging, exotic options, distributions, Monte Carlo distributions, Brownian motion, interest rate models.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Constructing and analyzing survey designs. Sampling and non-sampling errors. Simple random, stratified, systematic, and multiphase sampling. Methods of estimation.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Simple and multiple linear regression, cross-validation, bootstraping, subset selection, shrinkage methods, dimension reduction, decision trees, bagging, random forests, boosting, principal components analysis, clustering methods.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Probability axioms, discrete and continuous sample spaces, conditional probability, independence, one-dimensional random variables, moment generating functions, transformations, jointly distributed random variables.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Conditional distributions, sums of random variables. Chebyshev's inequality, central limit theorem, method of movements, maximum likelihood, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, two random variables transformations.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Elements of Bayesian statistics; Bayesian models; Monte Carlo for model fitting; hypothesis testing and model selection; hierarchical models.

STA4364 - Statistical Foundations of Dat.name: STA4364 - Statistical Foundations of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Statistical foundations of data science and artificial intelligence including probability, statistics theory, optimization theory, and linear algebra. Broad introduction to machine learning and statistical pattern recognition.

STA4365 - Statistical Foundations of Dat.name: STA4365 - Statistical Foundations of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: High-level Statistical foundations of the advanced models and algorithms of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Distribution-free tests on location and dispersion, goodness of fit tests, tests of independence, measures of association, nonparametric analysis of variance.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Twoway and three-way contingency tables, odds ratios, partial association, logistic regression and log linear models.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Statistical concepts and methods applied to the control of quality of manufactured products.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles of algorithms in analyzing data, computational concerns with statistics, principles of classification, association rules, belief networks, clustering, use of trees in decision making, visualization techniques, and the understanding of randomness in datasets.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Forecasting methods, time series analysis, stationary and nonstationary time series, ARIMA models, forecasting processes.
